Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality at Holiday”
Reviews.Author: James G
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great place to stay, this is it! Very nice rooms and a great facility, this is topped only by the great Staff. You really can tell that they care about their guest. The restuarant located just off the lobby serves a wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stop for the night”
Reviews.Author: Kelly L
Reviews.Content: We just needed a comfortable place to stop on our way between road trip stops and this Holiday Inn was a great choice. It's right off I-95 so it was easy to get to and then get right back on the road in the morning. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. The bathroom has a large shower with glass doors (no tub) and plenty of shelving under the sink so you don't have to clutter up the counter with toiletries. The staff was welcoming and very patient when we stumbled in around midnight, completely exhausted after a long day. I don't know if there's anything in the area worth seeing but I definitely recommend this hotel if you're looking to stop for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stop while on the road!!”
Reviews.Author: Nanspa5
Reviews.Content: Traveling from Orlando to Charlotte, this was our first stop Very nice and clean Breakfast not included but reasonable

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent traveler who has earned Platinum with Marriott, and Gold with Hilton. This stay has made me reconsider the Holiday Inn chain. The room was much better than the Hilton Garden Inn room I had last week in Orange Park, FL. Being a shower person who doesn't like showering in a bathtub with a curtain, I really enjoyed the walk in shower with great water pressure, and water that didn't smell like sulfer (like in Orange Park). The hotel is also in a quiet area, away from the maddening crowd around the beach area. I requested feather pillows when I booked and when I checked in the front desk staff handed me my feather pillows. A very, very nice hotel, and a great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and roomy hotel”
Reviews.Author: izlo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 3 days in may 2012 for business and vacation. the room is huge, clean and new with kitchenette. Location is good near the highway and close to everywhere. The only minus is breakfast, small choices. I recommend for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Quiet, Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: RichardHance
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a golf tournament. Room was clean and fresh smelling. Grounds were kept clean and trash free. Most of the front staff was eager to help aside from one employee who was texting on his phone while we stood and waited for him to check us in. Disapionted in the free breakfast, not much of a selection. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not much rest”
Reviews.Author: J_Main54
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the hotel was clean, the pool felt good and the hot tub was wonderful. The staff was very friendly. That was the good stuff! Now for the dig: As the title of the review indicates there was not much rest to be had. Here was the issue - we walked into the room and it was a little stuffy and warm. Within a minute the air conditioner turned on and the room cooled down. Whenever the compressor turned off so did the fan (usually there are settings on the AC that allow the fan to run continuously thereby keeping the air flowing and the constant hum makes for a good night's sleep). This AC had no such setting (kind of - explanation to follow). So, all night long the AC would turn on and we would get cold and turn off and we would get hot. We actually set the thermostat to 65 degrees to achieve some kind of balance. The second night we found the setting on the thermostat for the fan to run constantly - hooray! Not so fast. Same thing happened as the previous night except that when I would get up to check the thermostat the AC would turn on. EVERY TIME! It appears that there is a sensor that senses motion and turns on the AC (remember what happened when we first walked into the room). There was no way to keep the air circulating. Upon complaining to management they said that the AC was designed to turn off for 2 minutes every so often to keep it from freezing up. Running just the fan does not make the AC freeze up. They denied that there was a motion sensor controlling the AC. Coincidence that every time I got out of bed the AC turned on? Coincidence that every time we walked into the room the AC turned on? Enough about that. The reason we stayed at this hotel was that it was among the newest in the Daytona area. I can guarantee that we will not come back here. Besides the issue mentioned above, there is also no place to eat nearby. We found a few restaurants but there was some travel involved. They have a restaurant that is part of Holiday Inn but it tends to be pricey. Also the only way you can get a free continental breakfast is by being a Priority Club member and that will get you 2 breakfasts per day (if there are more in your party that's just too bad). If these concerns do not trouble you then enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ace”
Reviews.Author: CVCCpro
Reviews.Content: I tried this Holiday Inn in 2011 and returned with 4 of my golf schools that I conduct at LPGA. I found the hotel to be clean and very hospitable. The staff is great and were willing to help and assist us during our stay. My studens were very complimnetary about the hotel (I had previoulsy utulizied another hotel in Ormond Beach) and thought it was a vast improvement. We will be retunring in 2013

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, suites are large, front desk is great, everyone was very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: pileosnafu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the Weekend of April 7th 2012 for a friends weeding. The first night I was in a regular room, the second night I switched to the pull out in a friend's suite-room. Check in was very easy. They had room keys already coded for you. Very cool, you just showed ID, provided a Credit Card for Security (Never been anywhere where I didn't) and I was handed the booklet that had my name on it, and card inside with the FREE WI-FI code. FREE WIFI!. I've stayed at places that want to charge as much as $30 for Wi-Fi, its so nice when places see it as an added value, not a random revenue stream. The two queen bed room I stayed in the first day was very clean, and had a south east facing view toward the Speedway. Morning sun was bright this time of year if your not an AM person I suggest the Blackout curtains that are on a separate track from the sheer curtains (Nice touch having two types.) There was a desk to get work done, with a note that stated they had at the front desk Wifi Adapters if you needed one. This place is setup for business travelers and its nice to have access to local number and 800 numbers for free *Plus the wi-fi. Room came with a very nice iron that quickly moved through the packing wrinkles on my outfits. Bathroom was clean functional and spacious for a hotel bathroom. (It might even be larger then the bathroom in some apartments I've had.) What really made the stay was the "extra touches" done by the staff. As stated I was in town for a wedding. The bride and groom suggested the hotel and they worked with the staff to place personalized notes in each persons room that was attending the wedding. I was shocked to have one as I did not book this room until 4:00 A.M. the morning of my stay! That made the trip right there. They had worked with the staff & bartender to ensure their guests would be well taken care of, Megan the bartender was great in addition to being friendly and helpful to our large bar party even stayed a little late to ensure our full satisfaction! I checked out the workout area and was very nice and a step above the normal treadmill and lat pull down bar I've seen at most hotels. Keycard are awesome and use NFC. Every fiddle with your keycard trying to figure out the right direction to apply it, have that magnetic strip worn off? Battle with the door to gain entry in your room? Not here! They use NFC. Slip this card in your wallet and you're never going to lose it (unless you lose your wallet.) Get back to your room, waive your wallet (or card) near the door and it unlocks! Worried about security of this feature? Don't its harder the magnetic tech to forge a room key based on the coding of the locks. Its like that ID badge at work, or to enter your apartment complex. Here is the best part! I accidentally left my sunglasses in the lobby late Saturday night. I called up three days later. Spoke with the front desk, they took my name and number. Within ten minutes they called me back with wonderful news, they found my glasses. A few days latter they were back protecting my eyes from the sun!.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Done4Day
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on business and found the hotel to be very clean. My room was huge with a nice sitting area and comfortable king bed and great pillows. Nice fridge and kitchenette. Bathroom was very modern and clean. Had breakfast buffet on one morning and it was ok but since I was watching my carbs not much but typical carb breakfast fare. Service was very friendly in the restaurant. LPGA Golf course is minutes away and they have great rates and a nice practice facility and the course looked in great shape. The hotel is just off I-95 but not too much road noise in the room. It is also away from the main Daytona strip which is good as it is quiet and it is only a five minute ride to get to the speedway and the surrounding restaurants and shopping. There is a restaurant just on the other side of 95 from the hotel called Vince Carter's (the basketball star) Which I have also reviewed and worth a visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeff G
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, and overall, it was a decent place to stay considering the price. We payed 85 for the one night and that included one breakfast, which aggravated me because when we made on-line reservations it was insinuated that we both got breakfast. i simply went up to the front desk later that evening after they had a shift change and asked for my breakfast coupon and they gave me an additional one (problem solved). The hot tub isn't really hot, but it is loaded with chlorine, so don't bring one of your favorite bathing suits. We asked for a room close to the pool, which worked out well because there are two additional restrooms inside the hotel next to the pool. This works well when the bathroom is tied up in your room, especially when you are staying with someone other than your spouse. The place is clean for the most part with the exception of the shower area, which had mold spots. Staff is professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingwestI10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is off of I-95 far enough to be quiet. There is little traffic after 5:00 pm on the boundary road (Auto Circle Dr) since there are nothing but car dealerships along this road. It is literally 10 minutes to Daytona Speedway. The hotel is modern and clean. There is a restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. The bed was comfortable. The front desk personnel were cheerful and check-in/out went smoothly. Convenient, clean, safe, reasonalbe rate = good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A+++”
Reviews.Author: lila108
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during bike week and loved it! The hotel is very clean and modern. I was previously staying at the holiday inn express on Speedway Blvd, but after finding ants and seeing a bed bug on my bed, I moved here! What a smart move! I am very picky , I always inspect the mattresses in every hotel I go too, as well as the cleanliness, and at this location, you need not worry, the rooms are clean, the beds comfy, and staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Vista30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just off I95, just off LPGA Blvd. It is minutes away from the Daytona Speedway strip, far enough away to get a quiet night's sleep, close enough to all the restaurants. The beach is about 30 min away. The hotel was clean, modern, quiet and the staff were courteous. My one complaint is that the AC unit at night is a little loud but it becomes background noise eventually. This is probably one of the nicest places to stay in Daytona Beach proper.

Reviews.Title: “Best (!) Place to stay......REALLY!!”
Reviews.Author: Jack R
Reviews.Content: On a return trip from Naples FL we stopped for dinner at Dixie Crossroads (Titusville Exit 220....and don't miss it if you want superb seafood in casual setting) continuing to Daytona without reservations...picked up discount coupon book,,,arrived at HIE about 6 PM and got two queen bed room at discount rate. Motel is 3 years old in May ('12) but looks to be in mint condition. VERY clean, comfortable beds, granite surfaces in bath including shower, shower head that works and with water pressure to blow one away - what a PLUS. No comped breakfast because of "restaurant" on premises. Ample parking. One of - if not - THE most appealing lodgings along the I-95 corridor. Will be on our must recommend list indefinitely.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches found”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: First impression was great. Entering the room was another great impression. Half hour latter leaving the room I find a huge roach in the hall, stepped on it. An hour latter returning I find another roach in the hall. This time I gathered it up after stepping on it and brought it to the front desk attention. While somewhat concerned the answer was "it's bike week and we often find them with this crowd". Hey we will give you free breakfast as a way of saying appoligies. Why and the heck do I want to eat breakfast at a place that I know has roaches and why would anyone think a biker brings roaches? Hotel appears clean and yes I know hotels in Florida have roaches just did not expect such a lame answer.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 500. Location was good for the speedway. Of course it was expensive, but it was the 500... I'd recommend, no complaints. Front desk was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Garnett K
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff! CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN rooms! Comfortable beds, Nice decor. Everything worked. Nice showers with lots of water pressure. Our standard room with AAA discount was less than $90! BEST VALUE for the MONEY Hands DOWN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delicious Food”
Reviews.Author: Donna D
Reviews.Content: Our company has monthly meetings here and the food is always outstanding. The staff is so helpful and we always look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed at in Florida!!”
Reviews.Author: Stevetoscano
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to stay at this hotel. This was the nicest hotel we have been to in the Daytona bch area. It was quiet, clean and a great proximity to all the local attractions without all the hustle and bustle! I would recommend this to everyone. They also have a great GM that goes out of his way for his guests!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable Staff - clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Lea B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most hospitable staff members, has a great location for golfers, and was very clean and confortable. I would recommend this for any events you may be holding in the future as the staff was most accommadting to meet our needs.

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: Thesoupnazi88
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Had a pleasant stay, will return! The bar food is good as well as the service. Front desk exceptionally nice.

Reviews.Title: “3rd visit”
Reviews.Author: Nanette H
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying here in 9 months and each time has been great. Would never consider staying anywhere else in Daytona. Staff has always been pleasant and courteous, especially Dan the waiter. We anticipate many more stays over the next 3 years

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!!Best Stay Ever!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick L
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for the price.The rooms are top notch, marble tiles in the shower(?!),rooms spacious and enough amenities to make it an awesome studio apartment if it were in Manhattan! Excellent staff, Carrie at the front desk was a real treasure. The only drawback to the experience was the creepy little manager Richard. I think he was trying to be doting, but it came off a little uncomfortable. Not quite sure why. Other than that, have to say it was fantastic stay.....five star quality at four star rates. Will stay again when in Daytona area!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: muchfuntravelin
Reviews.Content: We arrived there very late & left early. We reserved at a "senior" rate, which was quite reasonable. As platinum priority members, we were given an upgrade on arrival. The room was comfortable with a comfortable bed, flatscreen TV, and nice large shower. The desk staff as well as other staff were very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute best place to stay near Florida Hospital!”
Reviews.Author: gc54
Reviews.Content: Recently, My wife and I traveled to Daytona from SW Fla. to see a heart specialist, with the procedure being done at the new Florida Hospital off I95 in Ormond Beach. But enough about me. Of course we consulted Tripadvisor, and found a fabulous deal for a huge, spotlessly clean, very comfortable one bedroom suite here at the Holiday Inn LPGA. The room provided a wonderful "home base" during a pretty stressful time. And while I was hospitalized, my wife was able to return home to our suite (at a ridiculously low $ 76 a night) via side roads each night to unwind and rest. The entire staff was courteous and helpful, and I just wish we'd had more time and opportunity to enjoy the on-site amenities. I can tell you that we will be back, as we have family in the area. If you need a comfortable place to stay in the Daytona area, especially if you're visiting Florida Hospital, I highly recommend the Holiday Inn LPGA Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: wallyh2u
Reviews.Content: Excellent service! Carrie is very friendly and easy to work with. Restaraunt staff were very courteous and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: utoometoo
Reviews.Content: The night clerk, Kerrie (from PA) was really friendly and helpful--so pleasant. The day restaurant guy, Dan, was very nice and found out he was also from PA. Made us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: fiona p
Reviews.Content: lovely staff, really helpful and friendly, bar is great, food is lovely, rooms are well equipped. the young lady, lareka, who serviced our rooms, was lovely, and really diligent. She left a note apologising for not being able to get our coffee pot completely clean, when it was me who had left it on, and allowed it to burn to a crisp!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shannon B
Reviews.Content: We we on our way back to Michigan when our car broke down. We needed a place to stay for the night while we figured out what we were going to do. The hotel was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. The rooms were perfect along with the rest of the facility. But it does not stop there I think this was by far the best experience I have ever had with customer service. John was so helpful with getting us phone numbers or whatever we needed to help us get on our way back home Thank you. The rest of the staff was also very friendly and courtious it over all was a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncree
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in -- and I've traveled all over the world -- I'm also very picky. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. My room was perfect. It had everything you could want -- large closet the the complimentary ironing board, luggage rack, etc. There was also another bench in the room that could be used for additional luggage. Wonderful decor -- very subtle and elegant. Very roomy granite and tile walk-in shower with towels on a rack in the shower so you didn't have to fumble around trying to find a towel to dry off. The countertops were all beautiful granite. The bathroom of course had it's complimentary hair dryer, shower cap, shampoo/conditioner, lotion, mouthwash. There was a separate area for the refrigerator and microwave with new coffee maker, coffee, etc. I wish they had had tea bags as well. The bed was very comfortable -- didn't want to leave it -- even the pillows were comfortable -- you had your choice of firm or soft pillows. The curtains kept out the light -- no peak-thru light of a morning. Large screen Visio television. Complimentary Wi-Fi -- nice desk area with comfortable office chair. There was also a comfortable sitting chair with ottoman. Complimentary continental breakfast included waffles, cereals, fruits, cottage cheese, assorted breads, bagels, coffee, tea. My only criticism was that the bagels were very hard and didn't taste fresh at all, the melon was not ripe, and bananas were not readily available. Cannot comment on the workout area or the pool because I didn't have time to use them but they looked inviting. Overall I would highly recommend this property and will definitely be staying there again if at all possible. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for lady golfers.”
Reviews.Author: Judith V
Reviews.Content: I was responsible for setting up a golf outing for 8 women from our club and we picked LPGA International. When I called them to set up our golfing, I asked for lodging suggestions. The LPGA staff emailed me several options. I chose this Holiday Inn and, boy, am I glad I did. John helped me get the best possible rates for all our rooms that ended up being a "Stay and Play" package. When we arrived, we were greeted by a friendly front desk staff. After settling into our spacious, clean and well-appointed rooms, Richard assisted us in getting reservations at a local restaurant. We will definitely make this a semiannual outing as long as there are rooms available at this Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here on multiple occasions for tennis tournaments and every time we've been here we have found the facilities to be clean and fresh and the staff wonderfully helpful with every issue and need. We can grab breakfast at the restaurant before matches, return afterwards to celebrate at the bar or sit around their cozy TV lounge, jump in the jacuzzi and pool to soak our tired legs, and then explore Daytona at the direction of their amazing concierge. This little hotel has a wonderful and helpful staff that bends over backwards to help their guests - especially John at the front desk - I think he actually lives there he loves it so much:) This place has a great karma - and good rates, too. A refreshing find.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: polyannaOntario
Reviews.Content: We just left Daytona yesterday after spending two nights in The Holiday Inn at 1615 Atlantic Ave. The check in was quick, efficient and the reception people were so friendly and helpful. Our room was spotless and being able to sit on the balcony and enjoy the ocean view was wonderfully relaxing. Everything we needed was available including microwave, fridge, coffee maker and free WIFI. I would highly recommend this hotel because of the service, easy parking and access to all amenities. Sue Miall Ottawa, Ontario.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility.”
Reviews.Author: Tammy L
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of working with Dave Bon Fleur, GM of the hotel. Dave assisted me in coordinating rooms for key employees to stay and work during the 2011 Biketoberfest event. The reservations were flawless, the accommodations great and the staff amazing. We will be using this facility again and I would highly recommend this facility to any organization.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jim2968
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on points and it exceeded our expectations. Auto-upgrade, clean rooms, very friendly staff. Even room service was available. The platinum club gift at the front desk was better than any I have ever received and I stay at these hotels a lot. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Biketoberfest and the staff were great. Provided bike towels and a wash station. The hotel is quite new and in great condition.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: annmarie s
Reviews.Content: I am a woman traveling alone and could not have found a better place to stop for the night. When I was checking in, John at the front desk was fast and friendly. I needed some local information and found Richard the manager was even more helpfull. Both Reggie and Robert went out of the way to make me feel safe and welcome. I always try to stay at Holiday Inn while I travel but the staff here made a good place even better.

Reviews.Title: “If all Holiday Inns were this nice I wouldn't stay any place else!”
Reviews.Author: cedar_shake79
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love this place!! Everything about this place is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Tom L
Reviews.Content: My brother and I have driven around 47 of the lower 48 states in the last three years -- 30,000 miles so far (we're still on our latest trip) and about 150 hotels from well under a $100 to about $400 per night. We've also eaten at restaurants where breakfast or lunch typically costs about $30 and dinner might average $75 (tops being maybe $250). So that's our background for judging places. We were forced by driving rain and hail to make it an early night at this Holiday Inn (after having a great time at Kennedy Space Center). It looks a bit above average from the outside. It's even better inside. The room was clean, bigger than we expected, and cost about $70 after either the AAA or AARP discount. Since we travel after Labor Day, I don't know what the rate for a room with two queen beds (like ours) would be, but that's what we paid. The pool was small but clean. The hot tub next to it was the same. The staff was very pleasant. The whole place just had a comfortable feel to it, despite being booked up due to a nearby tennis tournament. An even bigger surprise was the restaurant just off their lobby. My brother had salmon. I had a steak and crab cake combination. I'm not an expert food reviewer, but he liked his salmon, the salads were fresh, the carrots and aspargus crisp and hot, the steak was marinated in something that added nicely to the flavor ... and it was cooked the way I asked for it -- juicy light pink on the inside, seared on the outside. The crab cake was very good. Not the best I've ever had, having eaten many crab cakes in Maryland and having had some sensational ones on St. Pete's beach not long ago. But again, this crab cake was perfectly acceptable. The server was new, but was learning fast and trying very hard. She'll have it down by the time anyone reads this. Since there were few people at this nice restaurant, I asked the hotel staff about it. They said the chef was quite new and had changed much about it. I'd certainly recommend it to anyone in the area or passing through. (The chef did come out twice to check on how we were doing. Perhaps he did so because he knew of the server's inexperience, but he seemed genuinely interested in what we thought.) So that's it. My first review. My brother and I feel we should have written others because we've come across some other gems scattered about our amazing country. Thanks for reading it. Hope it was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Chamber Event Went Great!”
Reviews.Author: rderosa60
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to drop a quick THANK-YOU to the entire staff at the Holiday Inn LPGA. We held our MainStreetChamber networking event there on 9/21/11 and it was a SMASH HIT! The staff did a great job all around. Great food, great service & amazingly everyone who works there had a smile and great attitude. Our chamber members all gave great feedback. I live close by, so I didn't stay there, but we did take a tour of the guest rooms and they are amazing too. Clean, nicely appointed & very modern. I would highly recommend this property for a Chamber, Corporate or other group event, or as a nice place to stay.. Fantastic! Ron DeRosa President MainStreetChamber www.mainstreetchamber.org

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: MawMawx3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only two years old, but looked as though it was opened yesterday. Had a king suite, loved the exra space, wonderful bedding. Happy hour was going on so we took advantage after a long day of driving. Heather the bartender was delightful. Reggie the most awesome chef brought out wonderful appertizers. For dinner I had the sirlion blue cheese salad cooked to perfection, hubby had a club with delicious skinny fries. Very surprised at the quailty of food for a hotel resturant. Would highly recommend for the money, (we also had a cooked to order breakfast included in the price of our room). Will definitly stay again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Golf School”
Reviews.Author: CVCCpro
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn was a great upgrade and all my participants at the golf school loved my new choice of hotel. I have already booked and will be returning with 4 golf schools early in 2012. Holiday Inn is close to I95 and airport / has a bar / next door to LPGA / clean and comfortable rooms / flat screen TVs / staff is awesome / hot breakfast in the am

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Team”
Reviews.Author: D-Line11
Reviews.Content: This weekend we stayed at the Holiday Inn we were in town to see South Carolina State and Bethune Cookman play. The Holiday Inn is a wonderful place to stay just three miles from the Stadium. This hotel is clean and comfortable the staff was just awesome. This is were you may want to stop first when you are in Daytona. The Holiday Inn was a perfect place to stay for Club Blue I would highly recommend this hotel. “Great place for visiting fans to stay for the game”

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: FLN8ive
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! The rooms are well-appointed (the showers are even lined with granite tiles) and are clean and comfortable. I travel to Daytona on a monthly basis and try to stay here every time. It's a very easy to get to the LPGA Golf Course, the Daytona Speedway, the Daytona Beach Kennel Club and Poker Room and the airport from the hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful and the location is secluded, but secure. The only drawback I can think of is that it's about a 10 mile drive to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant was great! Convenient and great service”
Reviews.Author: deenuce
Reviews.Content: New hotel. Great staff. Great food. Good for family and for events.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel and use it often for couples retreats!”
Reviews.Author: JoelandKathy2
Reviews.Content: We are Joel and Kathy Davisson www.GodSaveMyMarriage.com or www.BestMarriage.com This is our exclusive hotel for our 5-Day Weekend Marriage Intensive retreats. All of the couples love the beautiful rooms, comfortable and beautiful amenities such as the large lobby, cozy lounge and restaurant area and beautiful pool area. All of the employees are awesome too! Five stars!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: skynyrd68
Reviews.Content: Made a resevation here after review Trip Advisor on our way to Port Canaveral to catch a cruise. The front desk associate, Carrie, noticed where we were from on our reservation. Turns out she had been to our small town on several occasions and knew many of the places and people we knew. She was so warm to us, we couldn't believe we had travelled so far from home and ran into someone who knew all about our hometown. She treated us like family. Hotel was beautiful, new, clean and spacious. Kids loved the pool after a long day of driving. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the food”
Reviews.Author: Lindak10
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was really great but the thing that will definitely bring me back is the food. The food was the best food I have had in a while. We ate there in the evenings and my compliments to the chef. My kids are very picky eaters but they ate up everything in sight each night we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel away from beach”
Reviews.Author: DARLE258
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, with new amenities. The staff was very nice and the restaurant food was pretty good and kids under 12 eat free in the bar and grill area. It is about 15 minutes away from the beach, so if you want a hotel close to the water, this is not it. The only turn off our family had on this trip was the room next to us which was non-smoking,some how got away with smoking and had the whole hallway smelling like smoke,which made me sick to my stomach.

Reviews.Title: “Large group attending wedding”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1230
Reviews.Content: We were attending our son's wedding at LPGA and stayed overnight . The Hotel was very clean, quiet, and comforable and that is all you need for a great stay. Very nice beds. and the rooms were nice size.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility and service”
Reviews.Author: ozmerish
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in, the staff couldn't do enough for me. Very well versed and knowledgeable about the area. An absolute pleasure to deal with. Room (220) was clean and spacious. Excellent water pressure for the double shower. Entire facility was clean and very modern. Definitely an example of a brand that has implemented an excellent product turn around over the last few years.

Reviews.Title: “golfers”
Reviews.Author: dcnglf
Reviews.Content: We had 16 ladies in our group. The Holiday Inn staff was outstanding. They were friendly and accommidating to all our need. The rooms were very clean and beds were extremely comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel. The manager went out of his way to make us comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JimKa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spotless. Service is great. We enjoyed a luncheon and banquet, both of which were excellant. Food was great. Service out of this world and friendliness of staff unmatched in the Daytona aea.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a model for all hotels!”
Reviews.Author: komodoman
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business and have stayed in a lot of different properties over the years. This Holiday Inn stands out for a lot of reasons, but the biggest difference are the quality of the employees. We made our reservation via phone at 11:00pm. Robert, the night manager, was both professional and very accommodating to our group of three. While the breakfast fare was unremarkable, the wait staff was unbelievably attentive. I observed one of the waitresses spending a lot of time with an elderly couple, making sure the women had eaten before taking her medication. You don't see that level of genuine care in many places any more. Almost forgot - the property was built in '09 and the rooms and facilities are all high quality and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean and new hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travlinround
Reviews.Content: Our stay last night was spectacular! The staff couldn't have been nicer. From the front desk staff to the restaurant, you could tell everyone enjoyed working there and helping people. The rooms are clean, fresh & new. The beds are sooo comfortable. My husband joked that he wanted to lower the mattress out the window and take it home! The pool and jacuzzi were the perfect temperature. Our boys played for hours. The frozen drinks are great and the food in the restaurant was tasty! An easy 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Cort75
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a travelball baseball team. The hotel was awesome..the rooms, the food, the service, and the amenities. We could not have aske3d for any more than what we recieved here. If we return to the area this would definatley be the place we would stay. The King suite is a huge room which gave us more space with the kids. The front desk was helpful with anything we needed. Thanks again for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: telllikeitis
Reviews.Content: Staff at check-in was very friendly and customer service oriented. Room was very clean. Nothing to complain about. Good experience and would stay here again. It is right off I-95, good for my purpose of spending the night and continuing my travel the next day down 95. Got fair rate on priceline.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service I have ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: daisy614
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. But unfotunately that is where anything good I have to say ends. We were travelling with a group of 15 people booked into 9 rooms for three days. The rooms were booked under a single reservation and paid for by a single card. Upon check-in, the front desk staff was incapable of assigning rooms in an orderly manner or with any efficiency at all. At check-in, they required a credit card for each room seperate from the main card used to booked the rooms. Supposedly this card was to be used for "incidentals" during the stay. After checkout, we arrived home to find that the hotel has charged us seperately for the rooms as well as charging the original card. Watch out groups, this hotel is double charging by using the guise of needing a credit card for incidentals. Be sure to check your charges carefully. After realizing they made a mistake, I immediately called the hotel to get the charges undone. I have called for two days, left messages with both the person in charge of reversing charges and with the general manager. No one has bothered to return my call. This is the worst experience I have ever had with a hotel and its personel. I have travelled to every continent but Antartica and have dealt with tons of hotels. Apparently the Holiday Inn chain does not believe in making the customer happy nor do they care about repeat service. I would definitely think twice before booking this hotel or any Holiday Inn if this is the way they choose to treat their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was BY FAR the best ive seen in a hotel yet.”
Reviews.Author: mccalpinml
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel while taking care of some family business during spring break this year and we were all very impressed. The rates were very good for what the hotel has to offer, the staff was ALWAYS friendly, accomodating, and eager to go the extra mile. My grandparents were able to keep their dog for a small extra fee, and where they could cut us breaks on the rates they did so. We ate breakfast at the hotel restarant everymorning and the food was delicious, or they have a cold breakfast buffet you can take back to your room for a very reasonable price. The hotel had everything you could need...a pool, a jacuzi, a workout room, laundrey room, restarant and bar, and an area with snacks and drinks available 24 hrs. The rooms are beautiful, new and very clean, and although house keeping did miss a day during our stay the staff was quick to supply us with fresh towells and anything else we might ask for. The location is also great for anyone who wants to stay in Daytona, but not directly on the beach. It is right off of 95 and LPGA blvd giving you an easy drive to the shore. I highly reccomend the hotel and if my family and I ever stay in the area again it will deffinitely be at this hotel! our group ranged from ages 17 to 68 and everyone was extremely satified.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessbomb7
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Clean, big rooms. Nice bedding and decent restuarant. I definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice, with some exceptions..”
Reviews.Author: Shars123
Reviews.Content: So, overall, this a a pretty nice hotel..the entrance, and lobby was very inviting. There were a couple of things that went a bit awry for my stay. I booked the Executive Suite in March 2010 for my Feb 2011 stay since I needed a room that held at least 5 ppl, especially during Daytona 500 NASCAR weekend. When I attempted to check in at 2/2:30 upon arrival, the very sweet and pleasant front desk attendant, said my executive sweet many not be ready (which she ran up to check). It wasnt due to a short-staff issue with housekeeping. I was told to come back in about an 1hr to 1.5 hrs to check in.OK no problem, I left and returned. When I returned I was told my Executive Suite was given to someone else and I was moved to a Standard Guest room. Even though my room was downgraded, the price was only $50 less than my premuim for the larger room. Why was I downgraded? Front desk mgr said "She was out for a few days and this seems to be happening to a few guests while she was gone" I had no choice but to accept the downgraded room (however, since only 2 ppl could stay in here, the rest of my party found a hotel about 45 mins away from Daytona and stayed there!) Not happy, but I didn't have much choice. (NOTE, I even called ONE MONTH prior to my stay to confirm my reservation and my room type...obviously that proved to be pointless) Once checked in and in my room, the previous guest bathroom garbage was still there. REALLY??! At this point, I was tired and did not feel like 'complaining' so I disposed of the remanant garbage myself. Not an ideal thing, but ok. The room was very clean and nice - typical standard 2 queen bed room. It was nice to have a mini fridge and microwave in case we needed it. Beds were very clean, pillows were small, but with the 4 or 5 on each bed, it made up for it! A few other reviewers noted the internet not working. And guess what...IT WASNT working for us either. I did call down to front desk also, and they suggested since th WiFi wasnt working, use the ethernet cable. HAHA, that didn't work either. When I went down to the front desk, she said she would have the manager reach out to us to remedy the issue, or at least see what the issue was. Guess what, we stayed there 3 nights and NO ONE attempted to contact us about the non working internet. I will say however, my brother who is in IT, figured out if you go directly to the entrance of your room, WiFi worked like a charm..but once in the interior, DEAD ZONE. I ended up buying a Hotspot while there for internet usage. Front desk mgr was REALLY nice about the lack of internet working for us, because on my last night there, she discounted the rate for that evening (thanks Carri). Overall, it's a very nice property to stay at. Safe, VERY CLEAN and great location. What I did not like was (1) previous guest garbage (2) non-working internet in my room and (3) which is the BIGGEST issue is being re-booked into a room totally opposite of what what my reservation had. I dont understand how my room could be 'given' away to a guest that arrived the same day I did, and merely requested a 'larger' room, while I RESERVED the suite at a high premium. I did write into the IHG/Priority Club Guest Relations, who advised within 48 hours the General Manager or Owner of the Property would call me to discuss. Guess what, that was 5 days ago, and I haven't heard from anyone. Advice to potential customers: if you need internet, have a hotspot or teeter off of your mobile device. AND call to make sure your reserved room type is CONFIRMED AND BLOCKED OFF (so your reservation won't be trumped and you wont be downgraded). I would still go back..but much smarter my next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: lilums
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for family funeral/visit - location right off I95 so convenient if driving down. Staff very nice - hotel clean and mattresses comfy BUT sheets, though clean, very scratchy/rough and pillows very lumpy/uncomfortable. Food was good and price not bad. But very disappointed internet in room didn't work but maybe 15 minutes total all week. Front desk gave us ethernet cable but that didn't solve problem - we didn't have problem at other hotels this week so not our laptop. Staff did say system being upgraded but for 5 days? Otherwise I find Holiday Inns a good place to say if it weren't for the sheets. Also bathtub has not traction at all so slippery but many hotels are like that I find. Noisy people in nearby rooms a few nights, slamming doors and kids running in halls - after 9 pm - wish staff had noticed and said something but I guess they can't control all the guests. Free easy parking. Overall good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: HavingFun50
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean hotel with nice room that is well-appointed. Free wi-fi, fridge, microwave in room. Great front desk service. Needed a pet friendly hotel. They have a pet weight limit and put you in a room near the lobby with easy access to the doors for ease of walking. Nice restaurant but free breakfast only with coupon. Good area for walking dog.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Good Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: TwoputtandMore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn on LPGA Boulevard very close to the LPGA Champions Golf Course. The clerk that checked us in was great. She was extremely fast in checking us in, gave us a very good run down of the hotel and its amenities and had a wonderful personality. The hotel has a small restaurant and bar that serves very good food and beverages. Happy hour is 2 for 1 drinks. Upon check out, the manager asked if we were playing golf that day and provided us with an additional discount for the LPGA course. The location was perfect, we were 5 minutes away from the course. The only negative was the air conditioner in the room, it sounded like a jet engine everytime it started up and ran. We told the manager about it at check out. It did cause us to not have a sound sleep but otherwise than that the hotel is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rockdale
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and extremely clean. We had a king room that had a walk-in shower. Not sure if the other rooms have walk-in showers. We were there for a college football game at the Municipal stadium and this was the closet hotel. There is a restaurant on-site which means no free breakfast. One exit south is where all the resraurants are located. The beach is about ten miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to call Home”
Reviews.Author: vfischetti
Reviews.Content: This place was EXCELLENT and the service i received by the front desk clerk was awesome awesome awesome. She was the best and the room was nothing less than perfect perfect perfect. Vinny Fischetti #307

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Nurseminnie
Reviews.Content: Very, very nice hotel. The desk staff were very friendly. The bathrooms are gorgous! Very clean and the bed very comfortable. We will definately stay there on ALL our visits to see our Son at Embry Riddle!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: bearboomer
Reviews.Content: All of the employees were very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is in great shape and everything in it is brand new adn top of the line. Extremely comfortable beds! There is also a very nice pool area. The hotel is for both those who travel with their families and those who seek relaxation. And the rooms are very spacious!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: razorfish355
Reviews.Content: This place was truly splendid. I was warmly greeted when we entered, provided a bag of essentials gratis, and given a very comfortable room. This place is clean and a pleasure to stay. The pool was luke warm and well kept. Whirlpool hot tub well maintained like the rest of the grounds. Even the floors were spotless; it is exactly what I am looking for when staying overnight. My wife and I were celebrating our one year anniversary and appreciate the top-notch quality this place and its employees had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Clean, and Courteous”
Reviews.Author: PTfamily
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Holiday Inn on LPGA blvd. The rooms were spotless, and the hot breakfast buffet was delicious. The beds were comfy, and even though it is just off I-95, very quiet. Staff helped us with directions and with activities to do around Daytona Don't miss the Lighthouse at Ponce Inlet THe pool was nice and relaxing after a Hot night at the Daytona Cubs game (minor league) A great place to stay for a decent price We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!! Nice clean rooms, it seems...”
Reviews.Author: Gatorlaz
Reviews.Content: Great spot!! Nice clean rooms, it seems almost brand new Staff very friendly, and helpful Will definetly stay here again when in Daytona

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Jetandfooma
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel done right. Clean, beautiful facility, comfortable bed/rooms and friendly customer service-minded staff. Far more upscale "feel" than your average Holiday Inn. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: lovemyboxers
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, not what I was expecting when walking into a Holiday Inn. Great staff and quick check in and out service. I was upgraded to a suite at no charge, large room, comfortable bed and very clean bathrooms. I highly recommend this hotel to others! See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Brand new & very clean”
Reviews.Author: domperignon85
Reviews.Content: Very nice, relaxing and enjoyable stay! Everything was pleasant from the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out. The desk clerk was very friendly and the rooms...well what can i say...they are BRAND NEW. A very clean and convenient lay out to the room. The bar, restaurant and fitness center downstairs are also convenient. There are plasma tvs everywhere you walk around the lobby. Will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Exeptional rooms and service. If you stay in Daytona, stay at the Holiday Inn at LPGA!!”
Reviews.Author: highhrider
Reviews.Content: I come down to Daytona Beach every quarter and I have stayed at many hotels within the Vicinity. Let me tell you, this newly built Holiday Inn is where I will be spending my business trips moving forward. The hotel is very clean, has a bar with a huge flat screen, very friendly and professional service and is very conveniently located. The beds this hotel seem like those high end mattresses which are extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Restaurant "kinks."”
Reviews.Author: JR1004
Reviews.Content: This property is fantastic - the bed was wonderful, the bathroom was great - it feels very upscale and the customer service was fantastic! Definitely not what I expected from a Holiday Inn...and after a long day of driving, the bar/restaurant downstairs was reasonably priced and comfortable and the wireless signal in our 2nd floor room was strong (and free!). The only negative part of our trip was breakfast - the manager (?) was also our waiter and it was clear that he didn't "work his way up the ranks." He was unfamiliar with the menu, served us coffee that was clearly the same pot brewed 3 hours earlier when the restaurant opened - that kind of thing. It was the only flaw in an otherwise impeccable stay and we chalked it up to a "kink" in this brand new property's process of finding a groove. You will not be disappointed with the accommodations - what a great place to stay!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Daytona Beach LPGA Boulevard
HotelInfo.Address: 137 Automall Circle, Daytona Beach, FL 32124
